alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Darlington and central Marlboro Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 749 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Mont Clare, or 9 miles southwest of Bennettsville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Dovesville, Mont Clare, Society Hill and Blenheim. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
